717236f-a.text:
332, 330-326 Broadway, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Worth Street. The one story frame structure 5 foot wide, occupying the corner and bearing No. 334 does not appear in this view. It would be on
the extreme left.
1911.

724826f-a.text:
Worth Street, south side, west.frow West Broadway, to and including Hhidson Street. Elevated shown on West Broadway, is the Sixth Ave. Line.
October 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr,

717247f-a.text:
Broadway (left midground) at Catherine Lane (center to rtght margin) showing at that point the old New York Life lInsurance Company Building with its clock tower. The photographer is viewing northwestward from a point near Elm and Pearl Streets.
Narch 28, 1931
P.L. Sperr

717231f-c.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Worth Street. Intersection shown in the foreground is Thomas Street. This is a set of 3 views from the same
vantage point.
About 1935.

717231f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Worth Street. Intersection shown in the foreground is Thomas Street. This is a set of 3 views from the same
vantage point.
About 1935.

717231f-b.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Worth Street. Intersection shown in the foreground is Thomas Street. This is a set of 3 views from the same
vantage point.
About 1935.

717246f-a.text:
Rroadway, east side, south from Catherine Lane (left) to Worth (right) Street, showing (in background) the tower of the Municipal Building across the newly constructed taxpayer on this frontage. At the left margin is a portion of the old New York Life Insurance Company Building. To the right appears the northerly side of the
16 story Central Syndicate Building.
April 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

720891f-a.text:
Leonard Street, west from West Broadway, to Hudson Street, showing prominently the north side of this thoroughfare. In the center is the former police station of 1868. This has the distinctive rooftop. The massive office and loft structure in the background is on the west side of Hudson Street, between
Harrison and Franklin Streets.
July 12, 1939
P. L. Sperr

717245f-a.text:
335 to 347 Broadway, (right) west side, north from Worth to Leonard Streets, showing prominently the Textile Building, at the N. W. corner of Worth St. Appearing on the left are No's. 91-87, 85-83 & 81 Worth Street, at, adjoining and west of the N. W. corner of Broadway. The Textile Building bears No's.
335-337 Broadway and 91-87 Worth Street.
About 1925
Edwin Levick
